raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: How do you feel right now?
System: At this moment I feel with my hands! I feel fine thanks for asking.
User: What makes you happy?
System: Talking to interesting people such as you makes me happy.
User: What makes you frustrated?
System: Because some people keep asking me stupid questions.
User: That seems pointed.
System: Makes sense to me.
User: I sense that I've caught you at a bad time.
System: That was very intuitive of you.
User: What would you prefer to be doing?

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey how's it going
User: It's good it's good. How are you?
System: good. it's really hot today. I think I'm going to the pool
User: Oh nice! Where do you live?
System: I live in Tokyo, Japan
User: Ahh yes, Japan is hot during the summer. Last time I was in Kyoto it was 114 degrees....
System: oh have you been?
User: Yes yes. I've been to Tokyo as well. It's so nice!
System: what did you do here?
User: Oh everything! I went to an onsen, the fish market, disney land and giant robot fighting show haha
System: lol why did you come to Japan just to go to Disney land?
User: The Disney lands are all different! There's also Disney Sea, which is completely unique!

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you doing today?
User: I'm doing great how are you??
System: I'm doing good. Just having some morning tea
User: are you a tea person or do you like coffee too?
System: I'm really a hot chocolate person. I don't drink coffee and I only drink tea when I'm trying to be healthy and want something warm to drink. What about you?
User: I love hot chocolate. Have you ever had european style hot chocolate? It's kind of like drinking melted chocolate bars haha
System: I recently tried it for the first time and you're right - it had a wonderful melted chocolate bar taste! I tried it up in a place in San Francisco and they had delicious homemade marshmallows too!
User: that's great. It's so cold these nights. Right setting for hot coco. Do you have anything you enjoy doing during cold times?
System: Traveling to warm places haha. When it's cold, you appreciate the warm climate more :) If I am not traveling, then I prefer there to be snow on the ground so I can go skiing or tubing down the mountain. What about you?
User: I tuck in blankets and read a book lol. I have never done tubing, but I seen some people do it. Is it worth it if you already ski?
System: Skiing involves a lot of muscle - especially in the legs so it is a workout. Tubing, you just sit and enjoy the ride down. Also with tubing, you can chain with your friends and go down together whereas with skiing, you're trying to not run into your friends.
User: hahaha that's a great way to put it

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello
User: Do you have a favourite flower?
System: hmm, I haven't thought about that much, but i think lotus should be one of my favorites. Why do you ask?
User: I'm working on a theory. Why does the lotus spring to mind?
System: Nice! Lotus looks pretty cool and It has some delightful vibe. So what is this research about?
User: Oh, it's not research! Just a personal theory. I think that flower preferences are more revealing of personality than people appreciate.
System: Interesting! Whats your favorite flower?
User: The gerbera. It's like a cartoon flower. As if you drew "flower" with a crayon and then it came to life.
System: Nice, i would love know more about your theory. Like how you can deduce personality from flower preference.
User: Ok, step 1 is, you ask someone what their favourite flower is. Pretty much like what we just did. Does that make sense so far?
System: yes
User: Cool. Step 2: talk with the person some more, and ask them some more questions, and gradually develop a sense of what they're like, over the course of maybe two to five years. And voila

System: I'm just joking with you. I don't play chess but I know some computers who do. I don't play chess but I know some computers who do.

User: Ok, so how do you program a computer correctly so it can play chess?
System: Use good algorithms and data structures. Alright then.
User: What kind of algorithms are those?
System: I read what you say and then I compose the best reply I can think of.
User: That's interesting, but I don't see what that has to do with chess.

You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.
